workbook.name: Real time transit truck monitoring
workbook.description: Monitor the temperature of cold storage transit trucks in real time.

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block 1
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "-- Reducing the default batch size for kafka so that tracks appear smooth. Larger batch sizes will render as big jumps when visualizing tracks.\nALTER SYSTEM SET PROPERTIES ('kafka_batch_size' = '10')"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Reduce the kafka batch size","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The default batch size when ingesting data from kafka is 1000 records. While this is good for most purposes, we will reduce that to 10 for this demo. This is because we want to generate a smooth visualization for the location of the transit trucks."}]}]

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics
(
    ID integer,
    "cycle" int,
    setting1 float,
    setting2 float,
    setting3 float,
    concentration float,
    flow_rate float,
    "compression" float,
    pressure float,
    volume float,
    mats float,
    dense float,
    volt float,
    cap float,
    stdev float,
    temp float,
    s12 float,
    s13 float,
    s14 float,
    s15 float,
    s16 float,
    s17 float,
    s18 float,
    s19 float,
    s20 float,
    s21 float,
    ttf int,
    ts timestamp
)"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE SCHEMA AND TABLES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kinetica uses schema's to organize tables. It is good practice to have a schema defined for each project. Tables that are created without an explicit schema assignment are placed in the default schema ki_home."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ABOUT THE TABLES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be working with two streaming data tables "},{"text":"with fake data","italic":true,"bold":true},{"text":", one that records vehicle locations and another that records vehicle metrics like temperature and pressure. Both these tables are recording information for transit trucks. The trucks are identified by identifier columns (TRACKID for locations and ID for metrics). "}]}]

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"REGISTER THE DATA SOURCES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Next we register the data sources from which we will be ingesting the data. We need to specify a separate data source for each Kafka topic. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"It's usually best practice to specify credentials separately so that they can be reused for the same provider (in this case confluent)."}]}]

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Cold transit truck monitoring system with Kinetica","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Interrupted or incorrect temperature control during transit is the cause of over one-third of the world’s food spoilage. This represents billions of dollars in losses every year. Maintaining the correct temperature in transit is THE challenge in cold chain logistics. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The temperature inside a delivery truck can vary a lot based on the number of times it is opened for deliveries, the weather outside or due to malfunctioning equipment. It is therefore important to monitor the conditions inside the truck at all times so that any shift from ideal storage conditions can be immediately flagged and corrected."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A real time monitoring system for cold transit requires you to combine different streaming data sources that record things like GPS, pressure, temperature etc. But the challenge  is that this information is often coming from different sensors which record and send this information out at different points in time.  So combining them is not a straightforward task."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"In this demo, we use Kinetica's ASOF join and materialized view capabilities to perform an inexact join between vehicle location data and metrics that is continuously updated as new data streams in."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"So let's get started!"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"⚠️ WARNING","bold":true},{"text":": Make sure to pause the Kafka stream ingest after you are done with the demo (see the cleanup sheet) so that your tables don't get too large."}]}]

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE transit_trucks.vehicle_locations
(
    x float,
    y float,
    TRACKID varchar(64),
    DEPOT_ID integer,
    sids integer,
    TIMESTAMP timestamp,
    shard_key(TRACKID)
)"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics_source
LOCATION = 'kafka://pkc-ep9mm.us-east-2.aws.confluent.cloud:9092'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'kafka_topic_name' =  'vehicle_metrics',
    credential = 'transit_trucks.confluent_creds'
)"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE transit_trucks.vehicle_locations_source
LOCATION = 'kafka://pkc-ep9mm.us-east-2.aws.confluent.cloud:9092'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'kafka_topic_name' =  'vehicle_locations',
    credential = 'transit_trucks.confluent_creds'
)"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA FROM THE DATA SOURCES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Now that the data sources are registered, we can start loading data from them into the tables that we defined earlier."}]}]

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"LOAD DATA INTO transit_trucks.vehicle_locations
FROM FILE PATH ''
FORMAT JSON
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'transit_trucks.vehicle_locations_source',
    KAFKA_GROUP_ID = 'BH_90210',
    SUBSCRIBE = TRUE,
    TYPE_INFERENCE_MODE = 'speed'

)"

77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
77eccbb0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"LOAD DATA INTO transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics
FROM FILE PATH ''
FORMAT JSON
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics_source',
    KAFKA_GROUP_ID = 'BH_90210',
    SUBSCRIBE = TRUE,
    TYPE_INFERENCE_MODE = 'speed'

)"

784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block 1
784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "-- Resetting the batch size back to default\nALTER SYSTEM SET PROPERTIES ('kafka_batch_size' = '1000')"

784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Drop the schema and all the tables inside it."}]}]

784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CLEAN UP","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Reset the Kafka ingest batch size back to the default setting."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Drop the schema and associated data"}]}]

784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "-- Drop the schema (and associated data sources)\nDROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS transit_trucks CASCADE"

784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
784e9ac0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "-- Drop the tables (we need to do this first because )\nDROP TABLE IF EXISTS transit_trucks.vehicle_locations;\nDROP TABLE IF EXISTS transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics"

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "SELECT ID as truck_id, COUNT(*) as count\nFROM transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics\nGROUP BY ID"

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"EXPLORE THE DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Workbench comes with built in tools (map block, data explorer and visualization tabs etc.) that make it easy to explore and understand your data. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Let's start by looking the number of observations in the vehicle locations data grouped by the trucks (identified by TRACKID)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎","bold":true},{"text":" "},{"text":"Note","bold":true},{"text":": It may take a few minutes for the data to show up based on when it hits the Kafka topic on confluent. "}]}]

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A MAP SHOWING THE MOVEMENT OF TRUCKS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kinetica provides geospatial object called tracks that represents the path an object takes across the map. A track is a combination of an id, timestamp and a point (lat and lon).  We can use this feature to represent moving objects on a map. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We have currently set the auto refresh option to 5 seconds. So the map will refresh every 5 seconds to show the movement of trucks over time as new data streams in from the kafka topics. You can use the configure modal to play around with the different options for the map block."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ Note","bold":true},{"text":": The tracks interface on Kinetica (as of version 7.1.6.9) "},{"text":"requires","italic":true,"bold":true},{"text":" that column names in the table that is being used to render the tracks be the following TRACKID, TIMESTAMP, x, y. The tracks currently will not render correctly if the columns are not named as above. Future versions of Kinetica will relax these restrictions."}]}]

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"EXPLORE THE VEHICLE METRICS DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Let's see the number of records for the vehicle metrics table."}]}]

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "SELECT id, HOUR(ts) as ts_hour, max(temp) as max_temp\nFROM transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics\nGROUP BY id, HOUR(ts)"

786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
786975c0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"VISUALIZE THE TEMPERATURE OVER TIME","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Workbench also provides a series of charts that can be used to visualize the output from select statements. We can use that to quickly plot the output from a select statement. Here, we use it to visualize the temperature over time."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ Note: ","bold":true},{"text":"The visualization will be sparse initially (most likely a single point) the first time you run the query below since because there isn't enough data to visualize. Try re-running the query in 30 mins to see more points."}]}]

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block 1
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"-- Create a materialized view that joins the two tables using id and timestamps
CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED VIEW transit_trucks.vehicle_analytics
REFRESH EVERY 5 SECONDS
AS
SELECT vl.TRACKID AS vehicle_id, DATETIME(vm.ts) as DATETIME, vm.pressure
FROM 
transit_trucks.vehicle_locations vl 
INNER JOIN transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics vm ON vl.TRACKID = vm.id AND vl.TIMESTAMP = vm.ts"

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A SIMPLE JOIN DOES NOT WORK","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The vehicle location and metrics data share an id column and timestamp. A simple inner join will try to match the records from both tables by id and timestamp. But this will not work. This is because the vehicle metrics are being recorded at a different timestamp than the vehicle locations. So joining them together will not yield as many hits because the timestamps don't align  (see animation below)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ Note","bold":true},{"text":": Wait till both the tables have records to run the queries."}]}]

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: "-- We don't get that many hits with this\nSELECT COUNT(*) FROM transit_trucks.vehicle_analytics"

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ASOF JOINS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The solution to this problem is an ASOF join. An ASOF join performs inexact joins by establishing an interval within which to look for matches. So instead of looking for an exact match, we look for matches within a specified interval as shown in the illustration below "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ Note","bold":true},{"text":": The illustration below references a different set of tables than those in this demo. But the concept is the same."}]}]

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED VIEW transit_trucks.realtime_vehicle_analytics
REFRESH EVERY 5 SECONDS 
AS 
SELECT
/* KI_HINT_PROJECT_MATERIALIZED_VIEW */
vl.TRACKID,
DATETIME(vm.ts) as TIMESTAMP,
vl.x,
vl.y,
(vm.pressure/100) as pressure,
(vm."compression"/20) as avg_compression,
(vm.temp/1000) as temperature
FROM transit_trucks.vehicle_locations vl 
INNER JOIN
transit_trucks.vehicle_metrics vm
ON vl.TRACKID = vm.id AND
ASOF(vl.TIMESTAMP, vm.ts, INTERVAL '0' SECONDS, INTERVAL '10' SECONDS, MIN)"

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE A MATERIALIZED VIEW THAT USES ASOF JOINS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The code below is similar to the query we wrote above but the big difference is that we add an ASOF statement at the end which establishes a 10 second interval with (along with some arbitrary stats)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"MATERIALIZED VIEWS KEEP EVERYTHING UPDATED","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The great thing about using a materialized view here is that all of the calculations and the ASOF join are automatically updated as new data streams in to the input location and metrics tables. We don't have to do any additional data engineering"}]}]

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ASOF JOINS YIELD MORE MATCHES","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Since we are using an ASOF join to establish a window within which to search for matches, we end up with more number of matching records."}]}]

78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
78a34a70-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"READY FOR SETTING UP THE MONITORING SYSTEM","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The code for generating the materialized view is deceptively simple but with just that single query, Kinetica will now listen for changes in the underlying input tables and update the materialized view (i.e. the ASOF join) anytime there is new data."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Now we can setup downstream alerts and decisioning systems that are triggered whenever the temperature (or any other metric) crosses certain thresholds. We can also build extensive dashboards that build on the information from this view."}]}]

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block 1
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE STREAM alert_webhook
ON TABLE transit_trucks.realtime_vehicle_analytics
WHERE temperature > 60
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DESTINATION = 'https://webhook.site/0bf1d616-7fb2-4ccf-9a94-a33287d9c09c' -- 'Paste Webhook URL'
)"

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Now that we have a continuously updated ASOF Join view that combines location and metrics data we can go ahead and point downstream dashboards and alerting systems to the materialized view table to get real time information on the trucks that are not maintaining the correct conditions for cold transit."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"SETTING UP AN ALERT FOR TEMPERATURE GREATER THAN 60","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"There are a few different ways to do it. We could set up a Kafka data sink that receives all new records from the portfolio alert table that we created in the previous sheet. We can use webhooks to setup alerts on applications like Slack etc."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"For this demo, we recommend using the website: https://webhook.site/ to generate a webhook URL. Copy the webhook URL and paste it as the destination in the stream below. This will send alerts to that URL any time the temperature value is greater than 60 for a particular truck."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"SETUP A DASHBOARD APP WITH REVEAL OR A THIRD PARTY WEB APP","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Finally, you can also build a dashboard app that provides a comprehensive view of the transit truck metrics. There are two paths for this. You can either use Kinetica's built in dashboard app Reveal or you can use a third party application like Tableau. For information on this please see the links below for more details:"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Reveal: https://docs.kinetica.com/7.1/azure/bi/reveal/"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Tableau: https://docs.kinetica.com/7.1/azure/bi/tableau/"}]}]

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"CREATE STREAM alert_slack_transit_truck
ON TABLE transit_trucks.realtime_vehicle_analytics
WHERE temperature > 60
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DESTINATION = 'https://hooks.slack.com/services/<ENTER YOUR KEY>'
)"

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"-- CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SINK transit_truck_alerts_sink
-- LOCATION = '<kafka cluster address>'
-- WITH OPTIONS 
-- (
--     kafka_topic_name =  'topic name',
--     credential = 'your credentials'
-- )"

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content:
"-- CREATE STREAM transit_truck_alerts_stream on 
-- TABLE transit_trucks.realtime_vehicle_analytics
-- WITH OPTIONS 
-- (
--     event = 'insert', 
--     datasink_name = 'transit_truck_alerts_sink'
-- )"

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE A SLACK ALERT","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The only change in the query below is that we use a webhook that is specifically for slack. You can find more information on how to set this up here: https://api.slack.com/"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ Note","bold":true},{"text":": Don't forget to update the destination url with your key if you would like to receive updates via slack"}]}]

79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.name: Block
79062af0-caed-11ec-bf76-4353fcc3ff97.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kafka sink","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"You can also send the alerts to a Kafka topic. Uncomment the code below and update the details for your Kafka cluster to point the alerts to a Kafka topic, which can then be used in downstream analytics or triggers."}]}]
